title: How does both the movie and book of the Great Gatsby explore the theme of 'Loss of Dream'? - Quora
tags: Literature of the United States of America

response.answer_text: In Gatsby, both the past and the future are dreams (illusions) which can neither be recaptured nor created, but for the characters in Fitzgerald’s story—remain tantalizingly elusive. Thomas Wolfe once wrote :”You can’t go home again” and that theme—the impossibility of recapturing one’s past, is pitted against the challenge of altering “kismet” the future path that fate has already made your destiny.
